content.description: Overhanging moves down low reach a long stemming section before finishing on the upper right face
content.location: Shared anchor with Cowgirls.  Just right of the steep cave start for Bucking Bronco.

content.description: A hard boulder problem down low with difficult feet yields to much easier climbing above
content.location: Around the arete to the right from Little Red Rooster, over a small cave with crimps

content.description: Fun, balancey climbing up entablature slopers and some gas pockets near the top on a less than vertical face. Much more interesting than the easy routes across the gully on the left-side of the Jigsaw wall.
content.location: Second bolted line west of the gully that separates the Hen House wall from the Jigsaw wall. There are two very similar routes here on the far right-side of the wall, both on slightly less-than-vertical terrain on highly featured entablature.

content.description: Pretty easy route. Makes for a good first lead. Make sure you're paying attention to the trail above. Sometimes rocks can get knocked off from it.

Start standing on a large block at the bottom of a big undercut area. Very fun moves on a short, powerful boulder problem to start (probably V3?). Yields to much easier climbing above it that just keeps getting easier as it progresses to the chains. Top part of the route would be very unmemorable, but the opening boulder problem is really pretty fun.
content.location: Second bolted line up the small hill to the climber's right of Cowgirls/GiddyUp (alternatively, the third bolted line as you travel west from the gully that separates Hen House from Jigsaw). Shares anchors with the bolted line that starts ~15 feet to its left. Near the very end of the Hen House wall.

content.description: A good route at the grade. Though it makes some Vantage 10c's seem soft.
content.protection: 6 bolts, 1" cam up high it says in book- not needed, maybe they added a bolt, I seem to remember it was run out , but not anymore, chain anchor.
content.location: after you turn the corner going to your right you will be under a big roof, first route is Hardboiled, 11a. Next is Scarecrow, 11d. This is the next route to the right.

content.description: Pull through a few tougher moves and then you're in the clear for the rest of this short climb.
content.location: First route after walking around the corner to the East of Little Red Rooster

content.description: Easy, fun looking moves on positive holds on very featured terrain.
content.location: First bolted line west of the gully that separates the Hen House wall from the Jigsaw wall. This is the first bolted line you'll see when walking across the Hen House wall toward the outlet of Echo Basin (toward the Columbia River).

content.description: This is hard for the grade. Has fun moves down low, which are a few grades easier then Cowgirls start. The crux is somewhere near the middle, a number of tension moves off slopers, get a few crimps, try to rest and more slopers, a thin slabby face near the top is cool.
content.location: furthest right before a dangerous looking chimney to scary chockstones.

content.description: the book says optional cam at start, and I would use it, because the crux is the starting sequence. Steep pumpy crimpy, slopeing holds follow.
content.location: 4th  route in from left corner with the 1/2" slot near start.

climbs.name: Did You Bring the Dog Biscuits?

content.description: Awkward bouldery crux right at the start of the route. Bolt line starts just left of the big undercut in the wall. Much easier 5.8/5.9 climbing above the crux.
content.protection: ~7 bolts to chains (shares chains with the route to its right)
content.location:
First bolted line up the small hill to the climber's right of Cowgirls/GiddyUp.

This is the left-most line in the Dog House area (a small area on the far east-end of the Hen House wall, with climbs that are much shorter than the other lines on the more established west-end of the wall).

content.description: I think this is the hardest 10c I have tried at Vantage. Most would be OS for me, but not this one. It's mostly in the starting sequence, a few pumpy moves up higher too, but a very technical few moves near the start shut me down.
content.location: next right of Stampede, up on ledges on the far right before the drop off.

content.description: Climb begins with a technical sequence with poor feet, the crux is this sequence to get to the mandatory underling to clip the second bolt.  Pre-clipping the first bolt is suggested.
content.location: 5th route from the left, starts back in a corner next to a cave feature.

content.description: Open project which currently goes at 5.12 A0.  Get out there and send this thing!
A very easy beginner trad route. Nice, stable stances the entire way up follow a narrow crack system.
content.protection: Small nuts and C3s. A pink tricam is probably the biggest thing that will fit anywhere. Shares chain anchors with Little Red Rooster.
content.location: Just left of Little Red Rooster on the far left side of Hen House, next to the color change that separates it from Millenium Wall.
